intro: Diplotaxis apula, commonly known as the Cape dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a raceme. It produces distinctive seed pods that are ribbed and contain numerous tiny seeds. Diplotaxis apula is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
